posts.post_content: This is the mythic that is most deserving of its mythic status. 5 mana for a 3/4 flier is not bad. Lifelink makes it much better. Lifelink and evasion on one card is always a beautiful thing. Pumping other creatures when you gain life puts this over the top, especially with the white lifegain focus in this set. And it's not legendary, so you could presumably have 4 on the field.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Probably obvious, but [Soul Warden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Warden) plus things like [Gather the Townsfolk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gather the Townsfolk). Each creature coming into play procs a different life gain effect, meaning for two mana, you're getting two 1/1 creatures, and a permanent +2/+2 on everything you own.  
  
@ about70hobos Yes, each instance of Extort is a different life gain effect.

posts.post_content:
Regardless of what impact this will have on constructed, she will remain at a good price for a very long time.  
  
- She's an angel. Casual players love angels.  
- She interacts well with lifegain. Casual players love lifegain.  
- She isn't super broken unlike baneslayer, which caused a whiplash against the casual community for how expensive it got (baneslayer broke $50 at its peak) and how pushed its power was.   
  
The casual crowd will lap this card up, just like how the casual crowd has caused bad cards like glimpse the unthinkable to reach unthinkable monetary prices.  
  
scavenging ooze at the moment is really the only card that "breaks" this, because the lifegain is in tiny chunks and each one will trigger archangel (whereas something like thragtusk would only trigger once). It still feels too slow otherwise.
posts.html:

- She interacts well with lifegain. Casual players love lifegain.
- She isn't super broken unlike baneslayer, which caused a whiplash against the casual community for how expensive it got (baneslayer broke $50 at its peak) and how pushed its power was.

The casual crowd will lap this card up, just like how the casual crowd has caused bad cards like glimpse the unthinkable to reach unthinkable monetary prices.

scavenging ooze at the moment is really the only card that "breaks" this, because the lifegain is in tiny chunks and each one will trigger archangel (whereas something like thragtusk would only trigger once). It still feels too slow otherwise.

posts.post_content:
I have a monowhite lifegain deck that has gone over a few small changes over the years - initially it had Cradle of Vitality in it, but I swapped that out for Well of Lost Dreams for some potent card advantage. With M14 I've swapped out the Baneslayer Angels for these, which is almost combining both the evasive wincon of the Baneslayer and the previous wincon of the Cradle into one neat little package.  
  
In particular, it pumps up my Walls of Reverence as well as herself, so if/when she ends up dying I still gain big bursts of life each turn.
posts.html:
I have a monowhite lifegain deck that has gone over a few small changes over the years - initially it had Cradle of Vitality in it, but I swapped that out for Well of Lost Dreams for some potent card advantage. With M14 I've swapped out the Baneslayer Angels for these, which is almost combining both the evasive wincon of the Baneslayer and the previous wincon of the Cradle into one neat little package.

In particular, it pumps up my Walls of Reverence as well as herself, so if/when she ends up dying I still gain big bursts of life each turn.
